org.usfirst.frc.team4146.robot

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team4146.robot.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class is a wrapper for the WPI Joystick class for the use of Xbox 360 Controllers (was Logitech Controllers)
    Author:
    GowanR, JacobE, EliE

      Constructor and Description
      Controller(int number)
      Constructor takes the controller number (0 or 1 with two controllers) and instantiates a joystick for that port

      • ctrlDeadband

        public static final double ctrlDeadband
        used by getDeadband functions. Values within the distance of this value from zero will be set to 0
        See Also:
        getDeadbandLeftXAxis(), getDeadbandLeftYAxis(), getDeadbandRightXAxis(), getDeadbandRightYAxis(), Constant Field Values

        public Controller(int number)

        Parameters:

      • getLeftXAxis

        public double getLeftXAxis()
        Returns the value of the x axis of the left stick. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered)
        Returns:
        a double of the x axis position for the left stick

      • getLeftYAxis

        public double getLeftYAxis()
        Returns the value of the y axis of the left stick. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) Value is inverted to make it so forward is positive because the default is backwards is positive
        Returns:
        a double of the y axis position for the left stick

      • getRightXAxis

        public double getRightXAxis()
        Returns the value of the x axis of the right stick. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered)
        Returns:
        a double of the x axis position for the right stick

      • getRightYAxis

        public double getRightYAxis()
        Returns the value of the y axis of the right stick. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) Value is inverted to make it so forward is positive because the default is backwards is positive
        Returns:
        a double of the y axis position for the right stick

      • getDeadbandLeftXAxis

        public double getDeadbandLeftXAxis()
        Returns the value of the x axis of the left stick with a deadband. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) ctrlDeadband is applied. Meaning -ctrlDeadband to ctrlDeadband values are set to 0
        Returns:
        a double from the result of joystickDeadband(double) for the x axis position of the left stick

      • getDeadbandLeftYAxis

        public double getDeadbandLeftYAxis()
        Returns the value of the y axis of the left stick with a deadband. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) Value is inverted to make it so forward is positive because the default is backwards is positive. ctrlDeadband is applied. Meaning -ctrlDeadband to ctrlDeadband values are set to 0
        Returns:
        a double from the result of joystickDeadband(double) for the y axis position of the left stick

      • getDeadbandRightXAxis

        public double getDeadbandRightXAxis()
        Returns the value of the x axis of the right stick with a deadband. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) ctrlDeadband is applied. Meaning -ctrlDeadband to ctrlDeadband values are set to 0
        Returns:
        a double from the result of joystickDeadband(double) for the x axis position of the right stick

      • getDeadbandRightYAxis

        public double getDeadbandRightYAxis()
        Returns the value of the y axis of the right stick with a deadband. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) Value is inverted to make it so forward is positive because the default is backwards is positive. ctrlDeadband is applied. Meaning -ctrlDeadband to ctrlDeadband values are set to 0
        Returns:
        a double from the result of joystickDeadband(double) for the y axis position of the right stick

      • joystickDeadband

        private double joystickDeadband(double joystickInput)
        Takes the value of a joystick axis and returns it deadbanded. (-1.0 to 1.0, 0.0 is centered) If value is between -ctrlDeadband and ctrlDeadband then value is set to 0.0
        Parameters:
        joystickInput - the value given to the function to be deadbanded
        Returns:
        the input deadbanded. (

      • getJoystick

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick getJoystick()
        Used just in case we need the raw joystick.
        Returns:
        Joystick used for the controller
